summary: This bill, the "Review and Evaluation of Strategies for Equitable Reservations for Visitor Experiences Federal Land Act" or the RESERVE Federal Land Act, tasks the Secretary of the Interior to commission a study by the National Academy of Sciences. The study will analyze existing Federal reservation systems used for recreational activities on Federal lands. It will investigate the history, benefits, challenges, and potential barriers of these systems, focusing on equitable access, user feedback, and best practices. The National Academy of Sciences must submit a report to Congress within 18 months of the agreement.
